name: crxify
body:
Say you're on a Chromebook, developing the next blockbuster Chrome Extension. There's no way to write extensions locally, so you're probably using [c9.io](c9.io). But how do you test it? Using crxify, of course!

## Shut up and pack!


### Restrictions / Requirements:
* You have to provide an URL pointing to a .zip
* The root of the archive has to be a directory, which contains your manifest.json
* for example: announcify.zip/somefolder/manifest.json
* **Give me a few seconds** (or minutes, depending on the size of your repository)

### Questions?
[Ping me](https://plus.google.com/108466870039650470305)!
